name: places/ChIJb7Ss0ARZwokRRCthBuet27c
formattedAddress: 333 E 38th St 5th floor, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 333 E 38th St 5th floor, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
This was one of the worst experiences ever.  I went to Dr. Stokes off a referral from my Dr who was not able to do what needed to be done - a shoulder aspiration with ultrasound. I was diagnosed with CPPD.  Dr. Stokes was sloppy with reading my MRI I supplied.  He asked me 3 times if it was my left shoulder.  My MRI clearly showed 2 large calcium deposits and a smaller one.  He looked baffled and mystified and concluded to me that it was not the crystals in my shoulder joint causing me all the pain I was in.  When asked what else they could be, he said he did not know and wrote me a script to physical therapy and that was it.  I sat across from him and his intern in disbelief and acute pain.  I started to cry from the pain and frustration and he just stared at me.  No words of comfort or hope.  I was in shock.  I left there upset and disgusted.   I informed my referring Dr about this diagnosis and he himself knew that PT was not the answer.  He helped me find someone close to my home at this point in Stony Brook LI.   This new referred Dr.  Took one look at my MRI and texted my arms motion and level of pain and said it was clear as day that I needed these crystals as by a Radiologist. He referred me to two places and I was seen that week.  I am pain free now!
I write this because Dr. Stokes was wrong, very wrong,  unprofessional and it should be made known to anyone out there living in pain not knowing what to do - Drs are supposed to help us not hurt us.

originalText.text: Very knowledgeable. Down to earth physician. Shows concern to the issue at hand. Not much waiting . x-ray,  mri and physical therapy can all he done in the same facility.
